meanings.definition: To present or offer as a gift or token of friendship.
meanings.sent1: She propines her friend a handmade card on their birthday.
meanings.sent2: He propines a bouquet of flowers to express his gratitude.
meanings.sent3: The cat propines a toy mouse to the dog as a peace offering.
meanings.sent4: The sun propines its warmth to the earth each morning.
meanings.sent5: The teacher propines knowledge to her students with enthusiasm.

meanings.definition: A gift or offering given as a gesture of goodwill.
meanings.sent1: The propines of cookies brought joy to the children.
meanings.sent2: She received a propines of fresh fruits from her neighbor.
meanings.sent3: The propines of a handshake sealed their agreement.
meanings.sent4: The propines of a smile brightened her day.
meanings.sent5: The propines of a kind word can make someone's day better.
